title: Additional definitions for (multivariate) polynomials
content: Remark: There are no theorems using these definitions yet!

blocks.name: cslv
blocks.content: Select a subset of variables in a multivariate polynomial.

blocks.name: df-mhp
blocks.content: Define the subspaces of order- ` n ` homogeneous polynomials. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mhp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  |- wceq(cmhp, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, cn0, crab(s3, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmpl, cv(s1))), wss(co(cv(s3), csupp, cfv(c0g, cv(s1))), crab(s4, crab(s5, co(cn0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s5)), cn), cfn)), wceq(csu(s6, cn0, cfv(cv(s4), cv(s6))), cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s4, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s5, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-mhp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  ‚ä¢ mHomP =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(Base `(s0[mPoly]s1))|(s3[supp](0 ` s1))‚äÜ { s4 ‚àà { s5 ‚àà(‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]s0)|(`' s5 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin } | sum(s6 ‚àà ‚Ñï0,(s4 ` s6))= s2 } }))
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s5, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-psd
blocks.content: Define the differentiation operation on multivariate polynomials. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-psd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  |- wceq(cpsd, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, cv(s0), cmpt(s3, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s0), cmps, cv(s1))), cmpt(s4, crab(s5, co(cn0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s5)), cn), cfn)), co(co(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), caddc, nat1), cfv(cmg, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s3), co(cv(s4), cof(caddc), cmpt(s6, cv(s0), cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(cv(s6), cv(s2))))))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s5, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s4, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
}

axiom df-psd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  ‚ä¢ mPSDer =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà(Base `(s0[mPwSer]s1))‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà { s5 ‚àà(‚Ñï0[‚Ü¶]s0)|(`' s5 " ‚Ñï)‚àà Fin } ‚Ü¶(((s4 ` s2)[+]1)[(.g ` s1)](s3 `(s4[oF(+)](s6 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶ if(s6 = s2, 1, 0)))))))))
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s5, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s6)
}

blocks.name: df-selv
blocks.content: Define the "variable selection" function. The function ` ( ( I selectVars R ) `` J ) ` maps elements of ` ( I mPoly R ) ` bijectively onto ` ( J mPoly ( ( I \ J ) mPoly R ) ) ` in the natural way, for example if ` I = { x , y } ` and ` J = { y } ` it would map ` 1 + x + y + x y e. ( { x , y } mPoly ZZ ) ` to ` ( 1 + x ) + ( 1 + x ) y e. ( { y } mPoly ( { x } mPoly ZZ ) ) ` . This, for example, allows one to treat a multivariate polynomial as a univariate polynomial with coefficients in a polynomial ring with one less variable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-selv(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  |- wceq(cslv, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, cpw(cv(s0)), cmpt(s3, co(cv(s0), cmpl, cv(s1)), csb(s4, co(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmpl, cv(s1)), csb(s6, cmpt(s5, cfv(csca, cv(s4)), co(cv(s5), cfv(cvsca, cv(s4)), cfv(cur, cv(s4)))), cfv(cfv(cfv(co(cv(s0), ces, cv(s4)), co(cv(s6), cimas, cv(s1))), ccom(cv(s6), cv(s3))), cmpt(s5, cv(s0), cif(cfv(co(cv(s2), cmvr, co(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmpl, cv(s1))), cv(s5)), ccom(cv(s6), cfv(co(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmvr, cv(s1)), cv(s5))), wcel(cv(s5), cv(s2)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)
  -| diffss(s4, s6)
  -| diffss(s5, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-selv(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  ‚ä¢ selectVars =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà P(s0)‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà(s0[mPoly]s1)‚Ü¶[((s0 \ s2)[mPoly]s1)/ s4][(s5 ‚àà(Scalar ` s4)‚Ü¶(s5[(√ó ` s4)](1r ` s4)))/ s6]((((s0[evalSub]s4)`(s6["s]s1))`(s6 ‚àò s3))`(s5 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶ if(s5 ‚àà s2,((s2[mVar]((s0 \ s2)[mPoly]s1))` s5),(s6 ‚àò(((s0 \ s2)[mVar]s1)` s5))))))))
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s6)

  ‚ä£ d(s5, s6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
}

blocks.name: df-algind
blocks.content: Define the predicate "the set ` v ` is algebraically independent in the algebra ` w ` ". A collection of vectors is algebraically independent if no nontrivial polynomial with elements from the subset evaluates to zero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-algind(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cai, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), crab(s2, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wfun(ccnv(cmpt(s3, cfv(cbs, co(cv(s2), cmpl, co(cv(s0), cress, cv(s1)))), cfv(cfv(cfv(co(cv(s2), ces, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cv(s3)), cres(cid, cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-algind(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ AlgInd =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))| Fun(`'(s3 ‚àà(Base `(s2[mPoly](s0[|`s]s1)))‚Ü¶((((s2[evalSub]s0)` s1)` s3)`(= |` s2))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
}
